Cyborg is a DC superhero, this version is based on the 2017 movie Justice League.
The build is a little bit flat for brickheadz
column3: t much lego could do to make him look perfect. I like the minecraft wood colour&nbsp
column4: for his skin. I think the pack is the most interesting with those iron bar pieces. His gun is a little bit flimsy but it holds if you don&rsquo

column1: I think this build is a pretty good build with minor faults in my opinion,

column1:
,TRUE,4,3,4,3,4 StarKiller22515","2019-12-08T16:45:43.19Z","BOOYAH!","

This brickhead was one of the earlier brickheadz to be released. It was one of the better ones though. His right arm has a cool build for his arm with a cannon on the end. His torso is pretty bland and only has the torso prints as detailing. His
column2: legs look like he has extra armor there which is nice. Most of the detail in the set though is in the head. They did a really good job when showing how the metal meets his skin and how e has little hair left. It just really makes him look like a cyborg. Overall this was a very good early brickhead. I would suggest picking this up if you are a fan of the DC Universe or like the DC LEGO sets.

s time to discuss another BrickHeadz set, wow, have I reviewed over twenty of these by now? Yep, and by and large they are all pretty similar in their overall design and general like of the set. Interestingly I never noticed before this is a 10+ set, I don&rsquo
column3: t know, I feel someone in the 6-9 age range might be able to build these too. I could be wrong though.

column1: Cyborg stands out on the front of this pack, it calls him out as Series 2 #24. A shot of the character from Justice League is on the side&hellip
column3: nope, just a shot of the Mother Box symbol. Was that the same as Aquaman? Oh no, each character has their own logo. Cyborg&rsquo
column4: s shining red eye symbol resembles the Mother Box symbol seems to be related somehow. I kind of prefer the Marvel Characters on the side shots. I wonder why LEGO and WB didn&rsquo
column5: t want them to be represented here. This packaging design actually is weaker than I initially thought when compared to others.

column1: Large Headlight bricks and some printed Cyborg specific armour plates are the watch word of this parts list. There&rsquo
column2: s a few dark tannish plates for Cyborg&rsquo
column3: s dark skin tone, I think this is a rare colour for these parts and something you might want for some of your builds. This use here for the skin tone is really impressive though.

column1: As with most Brickheadz the build is relatively the same, I say relatively because this figure does have a different arm design. I think this was the best aspect of this build, while the rest is still enjoyable it can get a tad repetitive to build BrickHeadz, even when we love the heck out of them. Cyborg once finished looks extremely impressive, with the single glowing eye and the printed eye.

His right arm is built and designed to resemble a blaster cannon, which is great because it uses two of the gold elements in standard LEGO grey to represent the cannon barrel. This is a great design idea and I wouldn&rsquo
column2: t mind seeing more of this in the future for BrickHeadz, different arm builds for different characters to give them something a tad more unique when next to their companions. There are at least five of the grey gold brick elements for details on Cyborg, two others on his back and one on his regular arm.

column1: Cyborg is one of the BrickHeadz that hung around longer than his allies, Flash, Wonder Woman and Aquaman seem to have sold better. I&rsquo
column2: m not sure why, Cyborg looks pretty boss and I can just hear him shouting Booyeah while firing on some enemies. If you still see him at retail I&rsquo
column3: d recommend him for fans of the line, although at this point I suspect most folks who wanted him probably bought him. I kind of wish LEGO would re-issue some BrickHeadz, I wouldn&rsquo
column4: t mind getting a few more that have retired, maybe make alternate costume versions to take advantage of such a thing. Recommended.
